participant.name: SURESHOT_PROGRAM_MANAGER
participant.persona: Project coordinator managing client relationships and deliverables

conversations.text: alright -- update for @SURESHOT_PROGRAM_MANAGER and @TEAM_MEMBER from our call today:

all the contacts i want to validate are in CRM, but the segment name field we discussed is not getting updated because of an issue on the 6sense side. i'm reaching out to them now -- TBD on the fix/timing there.

here's a 60-second video with some context on what i'm seeing: <CLIENT_URL/share/52f87ef6c1e94b538940fe4422e14d67?sid=710a79fa-d0a0-43ad-821a-a1d4e5ec2cee>

hopefully 6sense can fix the issue quickly -- i'd like to wait until maybe midday tomorrow to see if they can get the automation engine working again. that said, i do have a manual workaround for updating the field. i won't let this hold us up, so if 6sense can't get it together in time for us, i'll go the manual route early tomorrow afternoon.

replies.text:
hello! so here's what i'm seeing:

7,653 records needed to be validated, but i only see results for 18.

what are you seeing on your side? should i be seeing more than 18 results?

fyi, here's the full file -- all 7,653 records with the neverbounce fields populated for 18 of them.

replies.text:
I didn’t see any activity since yesterday.  In order to get into the flow the 6sense segment needs to change in value, so we are not pulling into the segment directly (although i can set it up that way).

i can load the list you provided manually, which will cover the historical records and then the private app to send the changes will hopefully resolve this moving forward.

alright, got an update!

data is flowing in beautifully. got all the results filtered down and we're only going to be marketing to those with a "valid" status from NB.

our first marketing campaign is hopefully launching tomorrow! so i'll be able to tell you what the actual results are so we can compare email deliverability against the data.

stay tuned...thank you!!

i will keep y'all posted here!

conversations.text:
hello! now that we have made progress with the neverbounce project, i would love to explore how you all could help us with another piece.

we still see issues with 6sense a) not having all the right people with the right titles in their db (but we can find them on linkedin, rocketreach), and b) not providing us with workable phone numbers.

is this something we could talk about? maybe leadspace-via-sureshot can help us here?

Yes. Absolutely, we are signing the Leadspace contract today and will have ability to use for both Sureshot and Xceleration. You want to have a check-in next week, or maybe early the following week (I am out April 2-7). We can check-in on the current Hubspot flow and talk thru this one

participant.name: SURESHOT_PROGRAM_MANAGER
participant.persona: Project coordinator managing client relationships and deliverables

conversations.text: perfect! would love next week if we can squeeze it in before you head out -- lmk if that works. thank you!!
I'll look for a time for us early next week

participant.name: SURESHOT_PROGRAM_MANAGER
participant.persona: Project coordinator managing client relationships and deliverables

conversations.text: invite accepted -- thanks!
ill be on in one moment, previous call is running over

participant.name: SURESHOT_PROGRAM_MANAGER
participant.persona: Project coordinator managing client relationships and deliverables

conversations.text:
hello! i have _plenty_ of updates for you from the marketing goings-on this week -- getting myself MARKETING_OPS_EXPERTized so i can share a snapshot of what neverbounce told us vs. what actually happened and also what our sales reps are seeing as they use the NB validation in their day-to-day.

as i'm wrapping that up: i'm seeing about 900 records in CRM that should have gone through NB yesterday, but did not. here's that CSV.

are you seeing these records hung up on your end? fyi, there was a bit batch that went through yesterday -- about 2.5K iirc -- and only this small didn't get processed.

cc @SURESHOT_PROGRAM_MANAGER @TEAM_MEMBER

Hey @TEAM_MEMBER yes I can see 840 failures in the workflow, which I can fix moving forward.  The issue is I needed to throttle the records checking Hubspot for the email address, as there are 429 errors which means we used the Hubspot API too much with concurrent requests.

ahh, okay! that makes total sense. lmk if my process needs to change at all -- but sounds like it doesn't and the issue is solved now on your side.

thank you!!
lmk if/when that batch is done -- then i'll hop back in and finish up my reporting for y'all
i already made the fix moving forward, and I’m reprocessing all the errors from yesterday so you should see the results trickling in the next hour or so.  Nothing is needed from your end.
wonderful -- thanks!
hello! finally sharing -- results from our first email send:

very pleased with delivery rate and bounce rate! hubspot has very aggressive bounce rate thresholds -- they aim for under .3% -- but i am happy with this. also worth mentioning -- not all were hard bounces (there were some soft bounces).

replies.text: @TEAM_MEMBER jumping back in to get up to speed here. what was our bounce rate before we began doing validation, ~10%?

elements.text: jumping back in to get up to speed here. what was our bounce rate before we began doing validation, ~10%?

replies.text:
gonna give you a long-winded answer...bear with me.

there are two types of emails we send:

• sequence emails -- automated from BDMs via HubSpot prospecting tools -- that rate was close to 10%, is now closer to 8.5%. we are making good progress. goal is to get it under 5%.
• then there are marketing emails -- batched, volume sends to larger audiences. we have done MUCH less of this, so the data is still coming in. but i can say we saw a bounce rate under 1.5% for the first send where we used NB results, and that was very good to see.
so yes, one of our baselines was close to 10%, and so far we are seeing good movement there.

elements.text:
gonna give you a long-winded answer...bear with me.

there are two types of emails we send:
sequence emails -- automated from BDMs via HubSpot prospecting tools -- that rate was close to 10%, is now closer to 8.5%. we are making good progress. goal is to get it under 5%.

then there are marketing emails -- batched, volume sends to larger audiences. we have done MUCH less of this, so the data is still coming in. but i can say we saw a bounce rate under 1.5% for the first send where we used NB results, and that was very good to see.
so yes, one of our baselines was close to 10%, and so far we are seeing good movement there.

replies.text: got it, thanks for sharing the JIRA link, that helped fill in the details for me

elements.text: got it, thanks for sharing the JIRA link, that helped fill in the details for me

replies.text: Also, any qualitative data on how the SDR team is feeling about the contacts coming thru (after validation)?

elements.text: Also, any qualitative data on how the SDR team is feeling about the contacts coming thru (after validation)?

replies.text: hi! i am getting myself MARKETING_OPS_EXPERTized to provide more feedback to you -- will arrive by end of week!

elements.text: hi! i am getting myself organized to provide more feedback to you -- will arrive by end of week!

conversations.text:
additional info:

we've run just about all the records in CRM against neverbounce, so we are "caught up" so to speak -- here's what we've got in CRM by email status:

replies.text: @TEAM_MEMBER are you all sending to any of the catchall addresses?

elements.text: are you all sending to any of the catchall addresses?

replies.text: we are not! playing it EXTRA safe up front. valid only for now.

elements.text: we are not! playing it EXTRA safe up front. valid only for now.

conversations.text: the 124 in the bottom-left with "No Value" are a few i need to look into -- investigate if they should have gone to y'all, and if so, why not.

little bit more about the folks who bounced:

• of the 22, only 16 were hard bounced (list attached here)
• the remaining 6 were soft bounces all from the same company -- walgreens and walgreens-boots alliance. having marketed and sold to them before, i can confirm they're hard to reach due to inbound email policies on their side. not surprised by the soft bounces.

final thing -- question for @TEAM_MEMBER -- when the segment name changes on a contact record, approx how long until y'all send the results back to hubspot? 10-15 minutes? writing some documentation, hence the ask.

thank you!

that would sound about under a light load, but the response would be delayed if a large volume of changes occured at one time, since I need to throttle the records for both hubspot and neverbounce.   If you had 1000 records at one time I would say it would take an hour.

Before we start discussing any enrichment pieces, just want to check in @TEAM_MEMBER to see how things are going at the moment and if you feel like we have a good working solution for the validation piece? I am sure we will make some refinements but just want to make sure we have that in a good place before we layer on some additional steps and data.

participant.name: SURESHOT_PROGRAM_MANAGER
participant.persona: Project coordinator managing client relationships and deliverables

conversations.text:
i do feel good about what we have in place. bounce rates aren't SUPER down, but they are down and i'm confident we'll see them decrease even more in the coming weeks/months.

for your information: here's the documentation on how we're using the process. this is technical requirements and end-user documentation. it also includes bounce rate tracking by month. i can confirm that april's numbers are looking good! but of course want to give it a little more time.

<CLIENT_URL/wiki/x/GAB21g>
Ok, great. lets now start taking a look at the Leadspace enrichment piece. @TEAM_MEMBER and I got access this week.

participant.name: SURESHOT_PROGRAM_MANAGER
participant.persona: Project coordinator managing client relationships and deliverables

conversations.text: Pasting in what you sent me earlier @TEAM_MEMBER looks like here is what we are hoping to do with the Leadspace data:

replies.text:
I’m indifferent if it was a scoping call or requirements are just spelled out here where we can continue the dialogue.

These are the things I would need to know to start:

1. The trigger: what actions and/or data should take place in Hubspot to trigger an enrichment update (created or modified in Hubspot)
2. Any filters to consider to filter in or out
3. The enrichment fields that you would like to map over to Hubspot.  Person Phone seems like the most of interest, but there are other fields that can come along the way that could provide value.  @SURESHOT_PROGRAM_MANAGER Perhaps you can provide your sample list to highlight the fields that could be mapped over.
    a. For each field you want to map over you would just need to make sure a contact field exists for this to be mapped in Hubspot

conversations.text:
• _*first, we want to use leadspace to get phone numbers for specific people.*_
    ◦ _there is a single field we’ll look at – “6sense account temperature” – and when the value is “Hot” or “Hot (New)”, we want to run the contact to append phone number._
    ◦ _direct lines are preferred – either mobile or office with extension/direct link to desk phone._
• _the other thing we talked about that requires more exploration: *could Leadspace help us identify more contacts at the companies we’re targeting?*_
    ◦ _6sense doesn’t always have the best people or titles – so, if we sent a list of accounts to leadspace, could they return targets that meet our persona criteria?_

conversations.text: Hey @TEAM_MEMBER sorry about not connecting last week but I was still hoping to nudge you regarding initiating the enrichment and discovery project.  Let me know if there is a good time this or next week to connect.
hi @TEAM_MEMBER! i am finally coming back to this -- thank you so much for your patience and follow-up!

i would love to chat with you/y'all sometime this week re: phone number enrichment. i am going to send over my thoughts re: a) a first batch run (we have a list that needs one-time enrichment) and then b) how to build this to scale like the NB integration.

i'll be in CLT this week, traveling up today, so it will likely be tomorrow/wednesday before i have everything in written format. but stay tuned -- i will have info to you and excited to make some progress!
